result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Alan Altpeter

defendant.name: Altpeter, Steven Alan
defendant.address: Price County Jail 164 Cherry Street, PO Box B, Phillips, WI 54555

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:22 pm - DA calls cases 16CF22 and 16CM36 and states appearances.  Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. Facts of case stated by DA.  Argument by Atty Richards.  Comments by DE.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Summation by Court.

Court imposes on Ct 3 of 16CF22
24 years prison, 10 years initial confinement, 14 years extended supervision  Credit for 1 day served.  Consecutive to any other sentence in being.
Court costs of $268
DNAAS of $250
Restitution of $300 + 30 = $330 on DRI case 16CM36
DE must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol as well as any controlled substances unless they have been prescribed by a physician and then may only be taken exactly as prescribed in the manner and form prescribed.
DE must take psych assessment and followthrough along with any treatment and counseling programs as necessary

DE not eligible for challenge incarceration program or substance abuse program.

Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

11:00 am - DA calls cases 16CM36 and 16CF22 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information has been filed, acknowleged and reading is waived.  Atty Richards presents court with waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court questions DE regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver.   DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Count 3 in 16CF22.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire form.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims right compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 3 of 16CF22, and on motion of state dismisses Cts 1 and 2 of 16CF22, and dismisses but reads in Ct 1 in 16CM36 for purposes of restitution.  Court orders Pre Sentence investigation.  Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Alan Altpeter
Current: Price County Jail 164 Cherry Street, PO Box B, Phillips, WI 54555   (Effective: 04-19-2016)
Prior: Price County Jail 164 Cherry Street, Phillips, WI 54555

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:00 am - Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter appeared with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Misdemeanor to track with Felony.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence
